body_html:
There’s a similar problem if you put torch.py in your directory, but you can’t do anything about this

This is different; torch is a pretty specific moniker that is unlikely to conflict with anything that is not torch; tools is pretty generic and in practice we got clobbered by the tools directory in https://github.com/onnx/onnx

Another thing I suggested before this code went in is was to move generate_code.py to the top level torch directory, so standard "search directory of source file first" semantics work. I still think this is a reasonable suggestion.
body_text:
There’s a similar problem if you put torch.py in your directory, but you can’t do anything about this

This is different; torch is a pretty specific moniker that is unlikely to conflict with anything that is not torch; tools is pretty generic and in practice we got clobbered by the tools directory in https://github.com/onnx/onnx
Another thing I suggested before this code went in is was to move generate_code.py to the top level torch directory, so standard "search directory of source file first" semantics work. I still think this is a reasonable suggestion.
body:
> There’s a similar problem if you put torch.py in your directory, but you can’t do anything about this

This is different; `torch` is a pretty specific moniker that is unlikely to conflict with anything that is not torch; `tools` is pretty generic and in practice we got clobbered by the `tools` directory in https://github.com/onnx/onnx

Another thing I suggested before this code went in is was to move `generate_code.py` to the top level `torch` directory, so standard "search directory of source file first" semantics work. I still think this is a reasonable suggestion.
